Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Navigation
  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows the robot to navigate to specific points and push blocks

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor Description
      private Navigation()
      Do not instantiate this class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static double distanceBetween​(Point p1, Point p2)
      Returns the distance between the two points in tile lengths.
      static double getDestinationAngle​(Point current, Point destination)
      Returns the angle that the robot should point towards to face the destination in degrees.
      static double minimalAngle​(double initialAngle, double destAngle)
      Returns the signed minimal angle from the initial angle to the destination angle.
      static void moveToBlock​(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Double,​java.lang.Integer> entry)
      Method move straight and stops once coming into contact with a block
      static void pushObjectOnRampAndReturn()
      Method that allows the robot to push the box to the top of the ramp and then descend to its starting position (bottom of the ramp).
      static void pushTo()
      Pushes a box from a starting point to an end point
      static void pushWithObjDetect​(Point destination, RampEdge ramp, int rampOrientation)
      Have the robot travel in straight lines with object detection
      static void travelAcrossTunnel()
      travels across the tunnel based on the given coordinates.
      static void travelBackAcrossTunnel()
      travels across the tunnel from the search zone based on the given coordinates.
      static void travelTo​(Point destination)
      Travels to the given destination.
      static void travelToSearchZone()
      Method which prompts the robot to travel to its respective search zone once it has arrived onto the island
      static void turnTo​(double angle)
      Turns the robot with a minimal angle towards the given input angle in degrees, no matter what its current orientation is.
      private static boolean verifyThreshold​(double cur, double end)
      Verifies if a given value falls within a threshold

      • turnTo

        public static void turnTo​(double angle)
        Turns the robot with a minimal angle towards the given input angle in degrees, no matter what its current orientation is. This method is different from turnBy().
        Parameters:
        angle - angle to turn the robot to
